data.question: What is the name of the heterobimetallic actinide metal-organic framework reported?
What strategy was used to assemble two coordination-distinct actinides into one framework?
What actinides are present in the SCU-16-U framework?
What property does SCU-16-U exhibit due to the presence of two distinct actinides?
What is the precursor MOF used for synthesizing SCU-16-U?
What reaction transforms the formate surrounded vacancy in SCU-16 to a carbonate decorated vacancy in SCU-16-U?
Why is uranyl selected as the second actinide for SCU-16?
data.answer: Due to its abundance in earth and low activity by mass.

data.question: What is the role of uranyl in the formate-to-carbonate reaction?
data.answer: Uranyl acts as a catalyst to promote the oxidation of formate by O2.

data.question: What additional functionality does uranyl bring to SCU-16-U?
What confirms the presence of uranyl in SCU-16-U?
data.answer: X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS) and energy dispersive spectrometer (EDS) results.

data.question: Is the structure of SCU-16-U identical to the parent SCU-16?
data.answer: Yes, the network connectivity and global crystalline structure of SCU-16-U is identical to the parent SCU-16.

data.question: Does SCU-16-U retain the thorium-derived catalytic property of SCU-16?
Can uranyl directly catalyze the formate oxidation in solution state?
Is the formate-to-carbonate reaction possible without uranyl?
Does the presence of a second actinide in the framework hinder the material's catalysis property?
Is the uranyl-catalyzed oxidation reaction independent of the reaction atmosphere?
Does immersing SCU-16 into uranyl-containing solution at room temperature trigger the formate-to-carbonate reaction?
What is the significance of synthesizing novel heterobimetallic An-MOFs with definite structure?
data.answer: It has fundamental significance to the development of An-MOFs.

data.question: What confirms that uranium in SCU-16-U is hexavalent?
data.answer: The calculated bond valence sum of uranium from crystal data and XPS results.

data.question: What does the presence of hierarchical pores in SCU-16 indicate?
data.answer: It matches the crystal data, indicating a well-preserved structure.
